jam.sort
Class SortDaemon

java.lang.Object
  java.lang.Thread
      jam.global.GoodThread
          jam.sort.SortDaemon
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable
public class SortDaemon
extends GoodThread

The daemon (background thread) which sorts data. It takes an EventInputStream, and a Sorter class. It reads events from the EventInputStream and gives these to the Sorter method sort(int []). Last modified 18 December 1999 to use RingInputStream KBS.

Since:
JDK 1.1
Version:
1.1
Author:
Ken Swartz and Dale Visser

public void setup(int mode,
                  EventInputStream eventInputStream,
                  int eventSize)
setup the sort deamon tell it the mode and stream

Parameters:

eventInputStream - the source of event data
eventSize - number of parameters per event

sortOnline

public void sortOnline()
                throws java.lang.Exception
Performs the online sorting until an end-of-run state is reached in the event stream.

Throws:
java.lang.Exception - thrown if an unrecoverable error occurs during sorting

                 throws java.lang.Exception

caughtUp

public boolean caughtUp()
Are we caught up in the ring buffer. That is there are no unsorted buffers in the ring buffer.
